ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Gained the ability and confidence to communicate in Chinese about common daily activities through multiple mediums (typing, handwriting, speaking).
I improved my beginner-level comprehension of written and spoken Chinese.

Grasp of the Chinese Language - especially for learning new characters and being more confident with oral presentations. Additionally, because the class met and had work for every day, I really appreciated the continuous engagement with the language which definitely helped at this level due to the integration.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Large amount of engagement, curriculum that builds upon previous material, excellent and supportive teaching.
Weaknesses: n/a, class was great

Strengths: I was really fortunate to have an excellent teacher who tailored the lesson to the strengths and weaknesses of our class. I loved how the class had a mixture of first years, upperclassmen, and grad students - this was a different dynamic to my other classes and was useful this year to outside of class develop relationships with people I would otherwise not have.

Weaknesses: Inevitably the sheer amount of work is sometimes overwhelming, especially when an oral presentation and a chapter exam on the same week. Additionally, I wish we had access to the slides we saw in class alongside the general presentation slides - this would have helped reviewing for exams a lot.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend to any student looking to seriously learn Chinese, assuming they have 1-2 hours/day to dedicate to self-guided learning.

Yes, learning Chinese is so incredibly hard! The instructors are great, particularly when it comes to learning tones, and I think that the Yale program, although a lot of work throughout the semester, is really effective.

As with any language course, if you are interested in the culture and the history of the country, or want to speak a language with friends, then language classes are always great. I feel that Chinese is especially well organized, but also especially difficult in terms of workload.
